page.title: 17Land, River and Air Travel
page.content: Most households in the block have at least one car. Public transport consists of buses to and from Hereford, some of these being local services but others serving outlying rural areas, especially on Hereford market day (Wednesday) and Saturday. These are run by several private operators as well as the Midland Red Company. There are no canals or railways, but the course of a dismantled railway from Hereford to Hay-on-Wye can still be seen. The nearest airports are at Bristol, Birmingham and Cardiff. The River Wye, a stretch of which runs through the block, is not used for trade, being navigable only by small boats and canoes.
